unnormalised: Someone asked what's the diff between a "VP" and a "Sr. VP" at most companies in India. Okay, so generally, a VP (Vice President) is a mid-level management position. Think of it like this: they're responsible for a specific function or department, like, say, Marketing or Operations. They report to a higher-up, could be the CEO or a Sr. VP. Their pay package? Maybe around ₹50 lakh per annum, give or take, depending on the company and industry.
normalised: Someone asked what's the difference between a V-P and a Senior V-P at most companies in India. Okay, so generally, a V-P (Vice President) is a mid-level management position. Think of it like this: they are responsible for a specific function or department, like, say, Marketing or Operations. They report to a higher-up, could be the C-E-O or a Senior V-P. Their pay package? Maybe around rupee fifty lakh per annum, give or take, depending on the company and industry.

unnormalised: Now, a Sr. VP (Senior Vice President) is a step above. They usually have more responsibility, bigger teams, and manage larger budgets. They might oversee multiple departments or strategic initiatives. Think of them as reporting directly to the top brass - CEO, MD, etc. Plus, they've usually been with the company longer and have a track record. Salaries? Def higher than a VP, could be ₹80 lakh + bonuses depending on the firm, sometimes even ₹1 Cr.
normalised: Now, a Senior V-P (Senior Vice President) is a step above. They usually have more responsibility, bigger teams, and manage larger budgets. They might oversee multiple departments or strategic initiatives. Think of them as reporting directly to the top brass - C-E-O, M-D, etcetera. Plus, they have usually been with the company longer and have a track record. Salaries? Definitely higher than a V-P, could be rupee eighty lakh plus bonuses depending on the firm, sometimes even rupee one crore.

unnormalised: Basically, Sr. VP is like VP, but more senior. More responsibility, more experience, more money. It's not just the title, but the scope of work and influence within the org that really sets them apart. Hope that clears things up, bhai!
normalised: Basically, Senior V-P is like V-P, but more senior. More responsibility, more experience, more money. It is not just the title, but the scope of work and influence within the organization that really sets them apart. Hope that clears things up, bhai!
